contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Golf Facility |golf_facility_name = Valhalla Golf Club |image = |location = [[Jefferson County, Kentucky|Jefferson County]], near [[Louisville, Kentucky|Louisville]], [[Kentucky|Kentucky, USA]] |establishment = 1986 |type = Private |owner = [[PGA of America]] |operator = <!-- name of organization/company --> |holes = 18 |tournaments = <!-- regualar tournaments held if any--> |website = [http://valhalla.pgalinks.com/ Valhalla Golf Club] |course1 = <!-- individual course name, can leave blank if same as article title--> |designer1 = [[Jack Nicklaus]] |par1 = 72 |length1 = {{convert|7540|yd|m}} |rating1 = 75.9 |record1 = |course2 = <!-- if only one course: leave this entry and all below parts blank --> |designer2 = |par2 = |length2 = |rating2 = |record2 = |course3 = |designer3 = |par3 = |length3 = |rating3 = |record3 = |course4 = |designer4 = |par4 = |length4 = |rating4 = |record4 = }} '''Valhalla Golf Club''', located east of [[Louisville, Kentucky]], USA, is a private golf club designed by professional golfer [[Jack Nicklaus]]. The course, which sits on a {{convert|486|acre|km2|sing=on|1}} property on [[U.S. Route 60|Shelbyville Road]] in the eastern portion of Louisville just outside the [[Interstate 265|Gene Snyder Freeway]], was envisioned by local business leader Dwight Gahm (pronounced "game") and his three sons in 1981, and opened in 1986. Keith Reese is the PGA professional. In 1992, Valhalla was named as host of the 1996 [[PGA Championship]]. The following year, the [[Professional Golfers' Association of America|PGA of America]] purchased a 25% interest in the club. After the 1996 PGA Championship, the PGA of America raised its stake to 50%, and announced that the event would return to Valhalla in 2000. At the end of the 2000 event, the PGA of America exercised an option to purchase the remaining interest in the club. Later that year, it announced that the [[2008 Ryder Cup|2008]] [[Ryder Cup]] would be held at Valhalla. Valhalla also hosted the 2002 [[PGA Club Professional Championship]] and the 2004 [[Senior PGA Championship]]. The 2004 PGA Championship was originally scheduled to be played at Valhalla but the PGA of America switched it to [[Whistling Straits]].<ref name=PGA>[http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=LH&s_site=kentucky&p_multi=LH&p_theme=realcities&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=0EB734D6021DC3B1&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM PGA HAS INSULTED LOUISVILLE, NICKLAUS]</ref> In 2009, the PGA announced that the Senior PGA Championship and the PGA Championship would return to Valhalla in 2011 and 2014 respectively. == Major tournaments hosted == The [[1996 PGA Championship]] was won in a playoff by [[Mark Brooks (golfer)|Mark Brooks]] over [[Kenny Perry]] with a birdie on the first extra hole, which was Mark Brooks' first and only major title. The [[2000 PGA Championship]] was won also in a playoff by [[Tiger Woods]] over [[Bob May (golfer)|Bob May]] in a three hole format. Tiger Woods had a 3-4-5=12 to Bob May's 4-4-5=13. This was Woods' second PGA Championship for his career, and his fifth major overall.
